stepTitle:
Carbon can be found in two different forms, diamond and graphite. Similarly, Phosphorus can be found in two different forms, White and Red. Given the following standard entropies and enthalpies of formation, using the Gibbs free energy formula determine which allotrope of phosphorus is thermodynamically stable at $$298$$ K:

P (white): ΔH°_f $$=$$ $$0$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$, S° $$=$$ $$23.30$$ $$ rac{J}{mol·K}$$
P (red): ΔH°_f $$=$$ $$-17.60$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$, S° $$=$$ $$22.75$$ $$ rac{J}{mol·K}$$
